summary: The document is an FBI identification form dated April 21, 1997, referencing a communication from July 30, 1963, related to the JFK assassination system. It involves a request from the FBI to the American Embassy in Rome, Italy, to check birth records in Caserta, Italy, for individuals named Vincenzo Roselli, Maria Russo Roselli, and Giovanni Roselli under the context of anti-racketeering. The search yielded no records for these individuals in Caserta or surrounding communities.
key_findings: The document is part of the FBI's records related to the JFK assassination system.
It details a failed attempt to locate birth records for Vincenzo Roselli, Maria Russo Roselli, and Giovanni Roselli in Caserta, Italy.
The search was conducted as part of an anti-racketeering investigation.
The document was originally classified but was released with deletions on April 21, 1997.
